snippet.title: Best tech cars
snippet.description: The following cars represent the most technically advanced available.

snippet.title: Hapifork Bluetooth-Enabled Smart Fork (White)
snippet.description: Can a vibrating fork create healthy happiness? We try the Hapifork smart fork at long last and see what it's all about.

snippet.title: Damson Jetstream Large
snippet.description: British electronics maker Damson unveils two Bluetooth speakers at CES 2014, the Jetstream Midi and Large, which have the power to adjust their audio based on their surroundings.

snippet.title: Tuning: In a nutshell, uprated suspension
snippet.description: Ask most people the best way to get from point A to point B quicker than the manufacturer could manage, and it's likely they'll tell you thatyou can't go wrong with a good-sized shove of extra power. But it's not always that simple. Big power in a chassis that can't handle it can actually slow you down.

snippet.title: Stasis: Audi tuning to the extreme
snippet.description: Tuning company Stasis makes Audis go very, very quickly indeed. Its story starts in the 90's, with a couple of guys and a broken Audi.

snippet.title: 2013 Nissan Juke Nismo
snippet.description: It may be funny-looking, but in Nismo form the 2013 Nissan Juke is one heck of a fun hatchback, with excellent performance technology. Just budget a little more to replace the cabin electronics.

snippet.title: Vibrating fork, smart scale could help you eat healthier
snippet.description: If you made a New Year's resolution to lose weight, you might need a bit of high-tech help right about now. CNET takes a look at a fork that helps you pace your meals and an app that lets you count calories easily and accurately.

snippet.title: HapiFork, the vibrating fork (pictures)
snippet.description: HapiFork's makers believe the vibrating fork is a simple tool to combat the weight gain which can lead to more serious and chronic conditions, like diabetes.

snippet.title: K-Break: Car tuning VIP style in Japan
snippet.description: K-break specialise in VIP tuning. This style, focused on looks rather than on performance, has been linked with the Yakuza but is for anyone who wants to strike an imposing pose on the roads of Japan. We find out what it means to be VIP.

snippet.title: K-Break: Tuning your car to be VIP
snippet.description: K-Break, in Japan, is a tuning house that's rather different to most. It's not all about power, but about looks.
